summary: “All right, we want to say something to our girls. Sansa, you’re a softie but a straight-up boss inside. Arya, you’re the exact...
body:
“All right, we want to say something to our girls. Sansa, you’re a softie but a straight-up boss inside. Arya, you’re the exact opposite. You all inspire us and we love you.”

-Jon on behalf of their brothers

reblog.comment:
“All right, we want to say something to our girls. Sansa, you’re a softie but a straight-up boss inside. Arya, you’re the exact opposite. You all inspire us and we love you.”

-Jon on behalf of their brothers

“All right, we want to say something to our girls. Sansa, you’re a softie but a straight-up boss inside. Arya, you’re the exact opposite. You all inspire us and we love you.”

-Jon on behalf of their brothers

summary: Sansa’s Power: The UnKiss and Why It Matters to George R. R. Martin’s “A Song of Ice and Fire”
title: Sansa’s Power: The UnKiss and Why It Matters to George R. R. Martin’s “A Song of Ice and Fire”
excerpt: The un-kiss is one of those great fan-fueled mysteries in “A Song of Ice and Fire”. Like everything in our story so far, there is more than meets the eye, layers of analysis, and powerful implicati…
description: Now I’m sure it has already been mentioned countless times, but I myself have just stumbled upon the theory and… it answers almost all of my questions about the UnKiss (which has bothered me for ages!). Headcanon accepted, waiting for an actual confirmation from the books.

reblog.comment: Now I’m sure it has already been mentioned countless times, but I myself have just stumbled upon the theory and… it answers almost all of my questions about the UnKiss (which has bothered me for ages!). Headcanon accepted, waiting for an actual confirmation from the books.

trail.content: Now I’m sure it has already been mentioned countless times, but I myself have just stumbled upon the theory and… it answers almost all of my questions about the UnKiss (which has bothered me for ages!). Headcanon accepted, waiting for an actual confirmation from the books.

summary: A friend forwarded this video to me and I have to say.... I don’t hate it?? In fact, I find it pretty compelling?? For those who...
caption:
A friend forwarded this video to me and I have to say…. I don’t hate it?? In fact, I find it pretty compelling??

For those who don’t wanna bother with the video, basically the long and short of it is, is that the “meaning” behind the UnKiss (which GRRM himself said will eventually payoff) is tied to the “kiss of life” that red priests and priestesses bestow on the dead to revive them – something Sandor has been witness to personally. The theory posits that Elder Bro has been doing this and that Sandor may learn how to do it himself and will at some point give Sansa the “kiss of life” to save her (or even vice-versa). Considering they are both “kissed by fire” already (his burned face and her red hair), it would all fit together. ;-) So basically the UnKiss is some kind of “premonition” or foreshadowing of this later Kiss of Life…

This could even work on the show too, since apparently Sandor is a full-blown red priest himself now, lmao. (Though he’d be more likely to use this power on Arya than Sansa, pffft…)

WHAT DO YOU GUYS THINK???

The theory posits that Elder Bro has been doing this and that Sandor may learn how to do it himself and will at some point give Sansa the “kiss of life” to save her (or even vice-versa). Considering they are both “kissed by fire” already (his burned face and her red hair), it would all fit together. ;-) So basically the UnKiss is some kind of “premonition” or foreshadowing of this later Kiss of Life…

For those who don’t wanna bother with the video, basically the long and short of it is, is that the “meaning” behind the UnKiss (which GRRM himself said will eventually payoff) is tied to the “kiss of life” that red priests and priestesses bestow on the dead to revive them – something Sandor has been witness to personally. The theory posits that Elder Bro has been doing this and that Sandor may learn how to do it himself and will at some point give Sansa the “kiss of life” to save her (or even vice-versa). Considering they are both “kissed by fire” already (his burned face and her red hair), it would all fit together. ;-) So basically the UnKiss is some kind of “premonition” or foreshadowing of this later Kiss of Life…

This could even work on the show too, since apparently Sandor is a full-blown red priest himself now, lmao. (Though he’d be more likely to use this power on Arya than Sansa, pffft…)

blog.name: winterfellchild
blog.title: The pack survives
blog.description:
"She (Daenerys) has the power to destroy, she can wipe out entire cities, and we
certainly see that in ‘Fire and Blood.’ We see the dragons wiping out 
entire armies, wiping out towns and cities, destroying them, but that 
doesn’t necessarily enable you to rule — it just enables you to destroy." GRRM

summary: On the battle of the bastards Jon is up against a formidable enemy. This battle is inevitably gonna end with a mess…...
text: On the battle of the bastards Jon is up against a formidable enemy. This battle is inevitably gonna end with a mess… unvictorious for both. However, the wonderful Sansa ( with the aid of Littlefinger) comes to the rescue of their army and saved them from certain demise and… Jon Snow is crowned KitN

title: S7 Budget!AU
body:
Okay but imagine one thing. GoT team doesn’t mess up and actually includes Ghost in the script.

Think of the reunions.

Littlefinger bores talks to Sansa in the courtyard but they’re interrupted by Ghost. He ignores Littlefinger, looking at Sansa and wagging his tail, slowly backing away towards the gate. And suddenly she just knows.

When Arya comes home, the guards won’t let her in. Ghost comes between them, growls at the two morons angrily and licks Arya’s face. “Welcome home, Auntie. Mom’s upstairs.”

And then he fucking eats Littlefinger alive being all like: “Jon Snow sends his regards.”

tags: I love when the cast appreciates tyrion lannister
summary: (Sophie Turner talking about the scene Joffrey abuses Sansa in his throne room) [...]and Tyrion comes and saves her from that...
body:
(Sophie Turner talking about the scene Joffrey abuses Sansa in his throne room)

[…]and Tyrion comes and saves her from that which is quite remarkable for her because who could have thought that a Lannister would have saved her”

Thank you, Sophie for this commentary. Tyrion is a Lannister but he’s also kind and his action on that scene proves that.

Bonus the part where she talks about how Tyrion comforts her after she talks to him about the Red Wedding, calling him “the unexpected Lannister” (in the way that he’s not like the rest of the Lannisters).

summary:
Jon: I have a plan. It might get us all killed, but if it works it will be a totally boss story. Cool?
Sansa: no, it's...
body:
Jon: I have a plan. It might get us all killed, but if it works it will be a totally boss story. Cool?

Sansa: no, it’s not!

Arya: cool!

Sansa: no! It’s not cool!

caption: — The 6.10 “The Winds of Winter” Script
